initial.title: Step 0: Initial State
initial.description:
SRT (Shortest Remaining Time) is a PREEMPTIVE scheduling algorithm.

Core Rules:
- Also known as Preemptive SJF
- Process with shortest REMAINING burst time runs
- Preemption when new process has SHORTER remaining time
- EQUAL remaining time: NO preemption (current continues)
- Tie-breakers: Remaining Burst → Arrival → ID

Our problem set has {num_processes} processes: {process_list}.

show_arrivals.title: Step 1: Mark Arrival Times (RS)
show_arrivals.description:
Mark when each process arrives.

Arrival order: {arrival_order}

RS markers show ready state times.
Note: SRT uses REMAINING burst (decreases as process executes).

continue_block.title: Step {step}: Process {process_id} continues (t={current_time})
continue_block.description:
Process {process_id} continues execution.

Remaining burst: {remaining} → {new_remaining}
No shorter process has arrived.
Block {block_num} of {burst}.

preemption.title: Step {step}: PREEMPTION! {new_process} interrupts {old_process}
preemption.description:
Process {new_process} arrives at t={current_time}!

Remaining burst comparison:
- {new_process}: {new_remaining} (just arrived)
- {old_process}: {old_remaining} (currently running)

{new_remaining} < {old_remaining} → {new_process} preempts!
{old_process} returns to ready queue.
